sub_topic: Calculating the pH of inorganic acid-base reactions
message_1: What is the pH of a 0.1 M solution of hydrochloric acid, assuming that the acid completely ionizes in water?
message_2:
To calculate the pH of a 0.1 M solution of hydrochloric acid (HCl), we can use the formula:

pH = -log10[H+]

Since HCl completely ionizes in water, the concentration of hydrogen ions [H+] will be equal to the concentration of the HCl solution, which is 0.1 M.

pH = -log10(0.1)
pH = -(-1)
pH = 1

The pH of a 0.1 M solution of hydrochloric acid is 1.
